REPORT FROM JAPAN! (EMPHASIS). A program of information
and commentary, treating current issues in Japan, This
program is produced on tape recording in Tokyo. Here, now,
is your host: Jo Ian Lurch.

Variety keynotes our program today. For we have an inter¬
view with Miss Aiko Kitaoka, costume designer who recently
returned from 3 years modelling and designing dresses in
the United States; then we turn to the local ceramics show
in order to learn something about the beautiful kiln-wares
of Japan. Furthermore we’ll put the spotlight on the
bustling economy of Okinawa. But now its time for the
highlights in the news.

HIGHLIGHTS IN THE NEWS FROM JAPAN!
Japanese Art Treasures will Tour Western Europe.
An impressive array of Japanese art will tour Western
Europe next year according to Yukiyo Yashiro of the Japanese
National Commission for the Protection of National Treasures.
It has been decided to limit the travelling exhibit to
paintings and sculpture. Perhaps the considerable success
of a similar exhibition in the United Stares two years
ago determined the choice. About 100 items will bo included
in the display, many of them vary old, coning from the
